showerReviews.reviewText: Love Francis Pool! Best experience there so far this summer (2025) thanks to amazing Amina (pool manager). Pool was very well run (rarely opened late) and facilities recently renovated and clean.
Nice pool. They blast music during the summer months but it’s a great spot to hangout. The locker rooms are large and clean.
Denied me entry to showers with my setvice animal in violation of federal laws and their own posted policy saying animals were not allowed "in pool area"

All it takes is one power tripping lifeguard with a microphone to ruin a pool day. The facilities are clean, there are plenty of chairs, but they need to get rid of the cops doing a pat down at the front door and not let that head lifeguard have access to the mic because he interrupts the music every 10-30 seconds.

I have a great time each time I come. I have been coming here since last year. I just wish they made more of an effort to keep the bathrooms clean and maybe the floors a bit more dry during the swimming seasons. Maybe putting some of those …

… don't mind having dirt and hair stuck to your feet. Not a lot of room to change your clothes. Last time, a homeless woman was in there to shower and was talking/cursing to herself -- which I didn't mind too much since she kept to herself. …

… maintained, and comfortable to swim in, in any weather thanks to adequate heating. The changing rooms - shower, bathrooms, lockers - all proper, well maintained as well. The only thing you need to track, and this is a minor hassle, is …

Bring your own locker room lock and slippers for locker room/shower areas - the floor is unfinished concrete and pretty gross. For a top notch swim facility the locker rooms and shower leave much to be desired. Pool is nice, lots of extras …
… family changing /shower area.

… the older Rec Center ones I've been in previously. They have Women's and Men's, but also a space for all genders with multiple enclosed changing areas with a toilet and shower. The lockers themselves were spacious and had loops for people …

… there are 15 unused lanes. It is frustrating. There's a nice hot tub and the shower facilities are great, including soap, shampoo, and conditioner dispenser. The pool is closed to the public late afternoon every weekday for swim practice.

Cons: the locker rooms need a lot of cleaning, the rusted shower curtains need to be replaced with the rust-proof ones, the air temperature in the pool areas and between the pools and locker rooms needs to be increased, the water slide …
Everything is fantastic! Except maybe the shower pressure.

The rudest staff I have ever seen I understand the need to finish your work before you leave but sheesh! Vacuuming and cleaning over people’s heads while they are working out and blowing dust all over them is  crazy business. + Steam room always broken = D-

This Y is superior to many. The interior decor is posh. Plenty of equipment, all up to date. There was no wait for machines. The pool is gorgeous and clean. The women's locker room is done up in expensive finishes and feels like a four star …
Not enough lounging chairs, no outdoor shower, which is an inconvenience at a public pool.

Loved the pool, but the locker room lacks most of the amenities you need like towels and soap. And you also need to bring your own lock to use the locker. (Haven’t been to other pools in the neighborhood so not sure if this is normal)

This is one of the best pools in DC, the location is great and not only is it clean, but the staff, with myriad personalities, are always kind and well organized. During the pandemic it was one of the pools where it felt safer as they followed their own protocols thoroughly.

showerReviews.reviewText: … point--but kids (and sometimes adults) jump and cannonball in; there's no rule against that. Positives: The bathroom/shower area is pretty clean. (But there's no bin for feminine hygiene products in the stall I used so... I guess …

The pool and facility is amazing, but not so for the lack of maintence. The mens showeres did not work, the locker room floor is flodded out into the lobby. At 3:30 pm they closed the pool to add chemicals instead of waiting after hours. …

It’s fantastic that there is another public pool in DC. Facilities are good and clean, and there are two swimming lanes. I think one lane would be plenty when the pool is crowded (see picture). Also, there is no shadow whatsoever, just 4 ombrelloni.

Excellent pool, nice facilities. Could do with more shade, but the buildings cast a long shadow in the afternoons, which covers half the chairs. Some complain about strict life guards, but I’d rather have strict ones than lax ones. Beware there can be a line on popular days.

Staff was delightful which is not the case at many pools in DC. Great to have a new facility. Seems like cheap materials have been used and I don’t expect this facility to last a long time. Pool needs to be cleaned & skimmed daily along …

Very pretty, clean*, and well manicured...but oh so very tiny for such a large complex. I hope I don't sound like a mean curmudgeon--I like kids--but it is absolutely overrun by children.  There is no adult swim. Sometimes the lifeguards …

Just for residents of McLean Gardens and their guests. Nice sized pool. A couple lines for lap swimming and a nice large area for leisure swimming. They also have pool noodles and some squirt guns for the kids to play with.

The pool building is nice with clean locker rooms (bring your own locks) and showers, but unfortunately they’ve made one side of the lap pool extremely shallow (<3 feet) so you can’t actually do a tumble turn while swimming…a number of …

My experience at **Reservoir Park Aquatic Center** was excellent! Despite being crowded on the weekend, the pool was **clean and well-maintained**, the staff **friendly and professional**, and the atmosphere **inclusive and respectful**. …

showerReviews.reviewText: Worked perfectly for our event. Food got a lot better on the second day. Everything was clean and organized. The technology and the internet connection were great for our needs. Everything was ready for us on time. The building is ample with a ramp for entrance. Restrooms are fully accessible. Staff are friendly and welcoming
Clean and spacious. Was a wonderful event (Dell's 70th) and I have nothing but joy to express. We had a lot of autonomy. Usage of a kitchen, plenty of chairs and tables.

The Festival Center is perfect for group events with its spacious meeting halls, high ceilings, and top-notch projectors. The venue also offers refrigerators, ample parking, and efficient air conditioning. Our event on Saturday night was a success, thanks to these excellent facilities and thoughtful amenities. Highly recommended!

showerReviews.reviewText: Cute, small playground. There are also basketball and tennis courts, a baseball field and a walking path. Plenty of benches. The rec center has a bathroom. Street parking only.
It's clean and safe, but the bathrooms could stay open later. They also book some sports on top of each other in the Baseball Field.
The location is perfect, with a nice view. The young kids playground has a nice sandbox, and the bathrooms are very well maintained.

showerReviews.reviewText: Not enough lounging chairs, no outdoor shower, which is an inconvenience at a public pool.

… to three stars because they completed a huge summer maintenance program. They cleaned the showers, steamed the pool deck, cleaned tiles, fixed some water issues, and more. It’s definitely cleaner and it smells much better. But it still …

This pool is very nice. Have a big changing room with shower and a locker space for you belonging. The kids swim lesson is fun the instructors are very knowledgeable they take time with kids to learn how to independent swimmers
Great facility with wonderful equipment for a  good work out. Beautiful pool and shower rooms.Workers are all so pleasant and helpful.

The pool is nice and clean but yhe women dressing room needs some clean up. The shower water is too hot and the door for some reason is always wide open and the men's is not. You can wnen changing in there if you are entering the building.

… water. **On a closed day they should clear the large paint chips from the bottom of pool.* Alot of children come here so dont try to take a nude shower nor tan topless! Lots of seating for the whole family or classes. Outside theres …
showerReviews.uniqueId: Monica Juanita Elizabeth Chriscilla Okeh_…_water._**On_a_closed_day_they_should_clear_the_l_Edited 6 years ago

showerReviews.reviewText: The pool and facility is amazing, but not so for the lack of maintence. The mens showeres did not work, the locker room floor is flodded out into the lobby. At 3:30 pm they closed the pool to add chemicals instead of waiting after hours. …

It’s fantastic that there is another public pool in DC. Facilities are good and clean, and there are two swimming lanes. I think one lane would be plenty when the pool is crowded (see picture). Also, there is no shadow whatsoever, just 4 ombrelloni.

Excellent pool, nice facilities. Could do with more shade, but the buildings cast a long shadow in the afternoons, which covers half the chairs. Some complain about strict life guards, but I’d rather have strict ones than lax ones. Beware there can be a line on popular days.

Staff was delightful which is not the case at many pools in DC. Great to have a new facility. Seems like cheap materials have been used and I don’t expect this facility to last a long time. Pool needs to be cleaned & skimmed daily along …

The experience I had at the Upshur pool was good, but someone who works there stole my money while I was changing my daughter's clothes in the bathroom. I left my backpack hanging with some wet clothes and a lady who worked there told me …
The pool is clean and the lifeguards pay attention, so overall the pool is great. The changing rooms are gross, so plan accordingly.

I love it!! Safe for children of any age 2ft- 4ft. 6in of water. **On a closed day they should clear the large paint chips from the bottom of pool.* Alot of children come here so dont try to take a nude shower nor tan topless! Lots of …

showerReviews.reviewText: The rudest staff I have ever seen I understand the need to finish your work before you leave but sheesh! Vacuuming and cleaning over people’s heads while they are working out and blowing dust all over them is  crazy business. + Steam room always broken = D-

This Y is superior to many. The interior decor is posh. Plenty of equipment, all up to date. There was no wait for machines. The pool is gorgeous and clean. The women's locker room is done up in expensive finishes and feels like a four star …

All it takes is one power tripping lifeguard with a microphone to ruin a pool day. The facilities are clean, there are plenty of chairs, but they need to get rid of the cops doing a pat down at the front door and not let that head lifeguard have access to the mic because he interrupts the music every 10-30 seconds.

I have a great time each time I come. I have been coming here since last year. I just wish they made more of an effort to keep the bathrooms clean and maybe the floors a bit more dry during the swimming seasons. Maybe putting some of those …

Updated August 8, 2025: I promised to update my 1 star review if I saw improvement and I did see positive changes today. I’ve bumped it up from one to three stars because they completed a huge summer maintenance program. They cleaned the …
Clean and well maintained. Swim lanes are not too busy. Only have had three on 1  once in the past 2 months. Staff is friendly and the yearly price is fair.

The kids area gets real crowded in the evenings with classes,  and so. Times its a struggle to find a lane,  but the facilities are nice,  well staffed and reasonably clean for a public pool. Arlington county residents get a discount for entry,  all others pay full price (check website for current prices)

Washington-Lee is a great facility.  I always get a good workout there.  The competition pool is very well designed and maintained.  The water quality and temperature are excellent.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  It is open both to …
The facilities themselves are nice, the lifeguard are pretty friendly, and the price is hard to beat, but the pool manager and admin team take this from probably 4 stars to 1 or worse. …
